questions.question_text: What is the default compression typo when unloading data from Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
By default, all unloaded data files are compressed using gzip, unless compression is explicitly disabled or one of the other supported compression methods is explicitly specified.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/intro-summary-unloading.html#:~:text=By%20default%2C%20all%20unloaded%20data,compression%20methods%20is%20explicitly%20specified.

questions.question_text: Which statement describes when a virtual warehouse can be resized?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A warehouse can be resized up or down at any time, including while it is running and processing statements.

choices.C: A resize must be completed when the warehouse is suspended.
choices.B: A resize can only be completed when the warehouse is in an auto-resume status.
choices.A: A resize will affect running, queued, and new queries.
choices.D: A resize can be completed at any time.

questions.question_text: What is the compressed size limit for semi-structured data loaded into a VARIANT data type using the COPY command?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
16MB is the answer

choices.B: Use a CREATE TABLE AS SELECT statement
choices.C: Rename the cloned schema and use an UNDROP SCHEMA statement.
choices.D: Contact Snowflake Support to retrieve the data from Fail-safe

discussion.content:
C is correct! 
If an object with the same name already exists, UNDROP fails. Need to rename the existing object, which then enables us to restore the previous version of the object.

questions.question_text:
User A cloned a schema and overwrote a schema that User B was working on. User B no longer has access to their version of the tables. However, this all occurred within the Time Travel retention period defined at the database level.

How should the missing tables be restored?
How does Snowflake recommend handling the bulk loading of data batches from files already available in cloud storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
answer should be C and D combined

Selected Answer: D
Bulk loading - bulk copy command

Answer D is correct.
Step 1 create external stage
Step 2 using copy into

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-gcs#:~:text=You%20can%20load%20directly%20from,manually%20or%20within%20a%20script.
